title: Projectile motion - range on Earth and Moon

content.question: On Earth, an object is launched horizontally with an initial speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> at a height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> and lands at a horizontal distance <math alttext="x sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></math> from its launch point. An astronaut on the surface of the Moon horizontally launches an object with the same initial speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math>, and this object lands at a horizontal distance <math alttext="x sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>M</mtext></msub></math> from its launch point. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction x sub E, over x sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>M</mtext></msub></mfrac></math> in terms of the acceleration of gravity <math alttext="g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></math> near Earth’s surface and <math alttext="g sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>M</mtext></msub></math> near the Moon’s surface?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction g sub M, over g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>M</mtext></msub><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction g sub E, over g sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>M</mtext></msub></mfrac></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="the fraction g sub M, over g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>M</mtext></msub><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction g sub E, over g sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>M</mtext></msub></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction g sub M, over g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>M</mtext></msub><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mfrac></msqrt></math>

topic.text: 1.5: Motion in Two or Three Dimensions

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
